node.title: Do you think there's a gender pay gap at your work? That info could one day be made public
node.alt: Employees working on laptops in an office.
node.description: More businesses may be forced to report things, such as whether they pay superannuation on parental leave, how much their chief executive is paid and provide a clearer breakdown of wages, if recommendations to a government review of the Workplace Gender Equality Act are taken up.
node.content:
["More businesses may be forced to report things, such as whether\u00a0they pay superannuation on parental leave, how much their chief executive\u00a0is paid and provide a clearer breakdown of wages, if recommendations to a government review of the Workplace Gender Equality Act are taken up.", "The suggested changes were made in a submission by the agency in charge of implementing the act, the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA)", "In a nutshell, the act is designed to encourage gender equality in the workplace by making some\u00a0employers report a range of areas such as\u00a0the gender split in their organisation and how much each employee is paid.", "Those organisations report to the WGEA, which\u00a0collates the data and reports back on how employers are tracking on reducing gender inequality and improving things such as\u00a0the gender pay gap.", "Currently, only private sector employers that\u00a0have more than 100 staff are covered by the act and are required to report to the WGEA.", "However, in its submission, the WGEA wants that to be expanded to include private sector employers with 50 or more staff and public sector employers at all levels of government with 20 or more staff.", "The agency's recommendations also include making businesses report:", "The WGEA also wants the gender pay gap for individual organisations to be made publicly available\u00a0\u2014\u00a0something both the federal Greens and the Australian Gender Equality Council\u00a0are calling for as well.", "All three submissions include recommendations to give the WGEA,\u00a0to various degrees,\u00a0more teeth to penalise employers who do not comply with the act.", "\"Many of the organisations currently listed as non-compliant have persistently refused to acknowledge their obligations under the act,\" the Equality Council's submission said.", "\"Public disclosure of their non-compliance has not resulted in any change to their approach.", "\"Only with an appropriate penalty regime, and responsibilities at the director level, will these organisations change their position and become compliant.\"", "", "
The Greens' recommendations were submitted by its spokesperson for women Senator Larissa Waters.(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "The Greens and the Equality Council are both\u00a0pushing for organisations and companies to have to include in their annual reports any changes in their gender pay gap.", "
Greens want harassment claims made public
", "The Greens' submission, put in by its spokesperson for women Senator Larissa Waters, wants reporting on sexual harassment introduced.", "Under its recommendations, businesses would report how many sexual harassment claims were made,\u00a0withdrawn or resolved within an organisation each year,\u00a0the average time taken to resolve complaints and any disciplinary action that was taken.", "It also wants businesses to report if they use non-disclosure agreements or have rules that prevent staff from speaking about their pay.", "The party wants employers to also be required to develop action plans to show how they plan to reduce the pay gap, and then report on their progress.", "Meanwhile, the Equality Council\u00a0backed calls to expand which employers would be\u00a0covered by the act, saying it currently only covered around 40 per cent of Australian workers.", "\"Local government employs more than 55,000 people and, in many areas, is the largest employer. Political parties should also be subject to WGE Act reporting,\" its submission said.", "\"Ideally, these public sector organisations should provide at least two years'\u00a0worth of data to enable a view of any change.\"", "Submissions to the review into the act close this afternoon."]
